{"rule":"NUMBERS_IN_WORDS","sentence":"^\\QSI Prefixes \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qfemto (f) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qpico (p) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qnano (n) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qmicro (\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qmilli (m) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qcenti (c) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qdeci (d) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qdeca (da) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qhecto (h) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qkilo (k) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qmega (M) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qgiga (G) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qtera (T) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qpeta (P) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Note: \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\QAngstrom \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\QÅ\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q m Mechanical Properties.\\E$"}

{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QRelationship Between Stress and Strain Tensile and Compression \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q (E (GPa or psi) is the modulus of elasticity) Shear \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q (G is the shear modulus) Note: The modulus of elasticity (Young's modulus) is the slope of the stress - strain plot.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\Q\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qatoms/unit cell \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qg/mol \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qvol/unit cell \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qatoms/mol \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qg/vol \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Where: n = of atoms in unit cell A = atomic weight \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = volume of unit cell \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = Avogadro's number (\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q atoms/mol) Ceramic Crystal Structures.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QFactors that determine crystal structure: Relative sizes of ions (\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q) Maintenance of charge neutrality (Net charge in ceramic is zero) Note: As \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q increases, so does coordination number Theoretical Density for Ceramics \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Where: n' = of Atoms per unit cell (For AX structures, this is equal for cations and anions) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = sum of cation molar mass \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = sum of anion molar mass \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = volume of unit cell \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = Avogadro's number (\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q atoms/mol) Rock Salt Structure.\\E$"}

{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QThere are two types: Hume-Rothery rule Conditions for forming a solid solution: Atomic radii must be within 15% of each other (%\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q) Electronegativity values must be similar (ie. Close together on the periodic table) Crystal structures of solvent and solute must be the same (for pure metals) Valencies should be similar (All else being equal, a metal will have a greater tendency to dissolve a metal of higher valency than one of lower valency) Maximum Radius for an Interstitial Impurity FCC \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q BCC \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Specification of composition.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QWeight Percent \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Where \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = weight percent of element 1 \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = mass of element 1 \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = mass of element 2 Atomic Percent \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Where \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = atomic percent of element 1 \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = number of moles of element 1 \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = number of moles of element 2 Note: \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q(grams) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q(g/mol) Conversion between wt% and at% \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Where \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q and \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q are the atomic weights of elements 1 and 2 respectively Line Defects.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QThere are two types: Hume-Rothery rule Conditions for forming a solid solution: Atomic radii must be within 15% of each other (%\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q) Electronegativity values must be similar (i.e. Close together on the periodic table) Crystal structures of solvent and solute must be the same (for pure metals) Valencies should be similar (All else being equal, a metal will have a greater tendency to dissolve a metal of higher valency than one of lower valency) Maximum Radius for an Interstitial Impurity FCC \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q BCC \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Specification of composition.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QCompute the resolved shear stress along a (110) plane and in a [\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q] direction when a tensile stress of 52 MPa (7500 psi) is applied.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QThe relationship between yield strength and grain size is given by the Hall-Petch equation: \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Where: \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = yield stress \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = friction stress (stress required to move dislocations, a material constant) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q = strengthening coefficient (a material constant) d = average grain diameter Solid-solution strengthening.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QRecrystallization replaces deformed grains with new, strain-free, equiaxed ones that have low dislocation density.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QDue to the presence of an etra half plane of atoms, there exists regions of compressive, tensile, and shear lattice strains around the dislocation line.\\E$"}
{"rule":"ENGLISH_WORD_REPEAT_RULE","sentence":"^\\QInductance Inductance measures the ability of a conductor to induce an emf in itself (self-inductance) or in another conductor (mutual inductance) as a result of a changing current.\\E$"}
{"rule":"EN_SPECIFIC_CASE","sentence":"^\\QFor a solenoid with length \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q and cross-sectional area \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q, its volume is \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q, and it stores an energy of: \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Qsolenoid \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q The energy density of the magnetic field is then: \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Since the magnetic field inside the solenoid is \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q, we can rewrite the energy density as: \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-|Dummy\\+|Dummy's\\+)[0-9]+\\Q Like how we found the general electric field energy density using a parallel plate capacitor.\\E$"}
